section.para: After a month of hard work the first issue of The Slack World is ready. This project was started by Mickhail Zotov and Alan Hicks to provide a high quality monthly Slackware Linux newsletter that provides in-depth articles and Slackware related news coverage. The project was first publicly announced on the alt.os.linux.slackware newsgroup:

blockquote.literallayout:
Newsgroups: alt.os.linux.slackware From: Mikhail Zotov <e-boogie blah@blah yandex . ru> Date: Mon, 28 Feb 2005 21:32:34 +0300 Local: Mon, Feb 28 2005 10:32 am Subject: New project: The Slack World
Ladies and gentlemen, folks, fellow slackers,
We are going to begin a new project (tentatively and very modestly called "The Slack World"). The main aim of the project is to fill a few gaps that we see in covering Slackware-related information by other resources.
The project is geared towards both Slackware veterans and novices. Currently, we think about covering the following main topics/sections:
* Feature pieces (aka Slackopaedia), i.e., articles written by experienced users for experienced users and newbies and covering subjects that are not widely known but useful (gnupg, apache, sendmail, mysql, backup scripts, etc.) This is to be a sort of mini-HOWTO section and may cover things included with Slackware or things not included with Slackware.
* Brief reviews of the changes in -current tree (aka Slack News).
* The most insightful and information things mentioned in AOLS or ##slackware or #slackware or elsewhere (aka Slack Wisdom).
* Information about new or existing third party tools developed around Slackware, including distributions based on Slack.
* Possibly, other topics related to Slackware and Linux in general (e.g., links to articles that may be of general interest).
We intend to implement the project as a monthly newsletter backed by a no-frills website.
We would very much like to hear your opinions, ideas, suggestions. We also invite volunteers to join the project. Last but not least, we would very much like to receive your articles, tips, links, etc. as soon as the project is up and you like it. :-)
Best regards,
Alan Hicks (http://slackbook.lizella.net) and Mikhail Zotov (http://slackfire.narod.ru)

section.para: Along the way Daniel de Kok also joined the project as an author and editor, and worked on the XML framework. Unfortunately Alan Hicks had to drop the project, due to other commitments.

We are aware of the fact that new Slackware-related initiatives pop up everywhere every month, and that we will have to prove ourselves to be a project that provides valuable information and continuity. We ask you, as a reader, to judge our little new project by the quality of the contents, and to provide feedback. We just got started, and would like to know how we can improve things
This first issue contains some sections that we plan to include every month:

itemizedlist.listitem: Editorial: what is a magazine without an editorial? The editorial will comment on new developments in the GNU/Linux world, or beg for new articles.
Slack News: the Slack News section is a monthly summary of developments related to Slackware Linux.
Slack Wisdom: Slack Wisdom is a montly section that gathers Slack wisdom from various newsgroups and mailinglists.
Slackopedia: The Slackopedia section contains an in-depth article about some Slackware-related subject.

section.para: We hope that you will enjoy this first issue, have a good read!
section.literallayout:
Your editors,
Daniel de Kok Mickhail Zotov
